doc.field: João José da Silva bond to George Gosman
João José da Silva bond to George Gosman

Bond for 1,875 pounds, payable on 1 March 1799, from merchant João José da Silva of New York City to bricklayer George Gosman, also of New York City. Dated 1 March 1796. Signed by da Silva and by witnesses Peter Augustus Jay and Robert Gosman. For a consideration of ten shillings, José Joaquim da Costa co-signed the bond as co-obligor, and da Costa's obligation is also signed by witnesses Peter Augustus Jay and Robert Gosman. For more information and to request this item, see the catalog record, or write to manuscripts@nyhistory.org.
